intro: Stenomesson leucanthum, commonly known as the white-flowered stenomesson, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is known for its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Stenomesson leucanthum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
